string-array.name: quotes
string-array.item: "We have to experience sadness to recognize happiness, unless you have depression, every day is bad then."
"You get something whenever you look fear in its eyes and say, \"I'd better leave.\""
"If imagination is stronger than knowledge, I couldn't say, but I hope my cardiologist studied more than imagined."
"Character can only be obtained from trial and suffering, but I think it’s best to leave it for tomorrow."
"The adventure is worth it, if it is within the international safety standards."
"Parents are meant to give things to children that they will ignore, such as respect and education."
"Demand more from yourself than any other demands from you. With some drugs it is possible to cope with the increasing mental pressure."
"If you come to a crossroads, check the GPS to check the right direction."
"It is possible that the universe is full of life, but let us hope that it not or comes to destroy us."
"Life consists of playing well the cards given to you, but if you start with king and aces is much easier."
"Love without dialogue is strange. Get down from the tree and drop the binoculars."
"If in doubt, don’t do it. It's a good way to do nothing in life."
"Cats are a good reminder that we are not the smartest beings on earth."
"Nothing in the world has ever been completed without passion and money."
"Be true, getting caught up in a lie is almost as bad as being a Nazi."
"Chess is just another way of feeling stupid."
"It is always best to stay clean and transparent, like a window, since most people look through you."
"Music is like a painting, they say it's art and I think I would do better, if I had any talent."
"I had to live in the desert to appreciate piped water.\n - Anonymous Survivor"
"True knowledge is really understanding the extent of our ignorance."
"Maybe this world is the hell of another planet.\n - Aldous Huxley"
"My father used to say that if you had five friends when you died, you died early."
"The only limit is your bank account."
"Difficult roads lead to worse places."
"Do not stop when you're tired, or stop, I'm not your father."
"We have to assert ourselves every day, but today I will watch Netflix."
"Life is what happens while we're awake."
"Life is 10% what happens and 90% thinking about your embarrassing moments."
"Hope is the last to die, the first is patience."
"Our great weakness is to try, if you do not try, you cannot lose."
"If you can push a task another day, do it."
"If it seems impossible, it probably is."
"If things are bad at work, there is not much to do."
"Always do your best, unless it is very difficult, in that case let it go."
"It doesn't matter how slow you go, actually, it does if your enemies are faster."
"New day, same concerns."
"The past can not be changed, the future does not seem any better."
"Believe in yourself, because I won’t."
"Writing your goals is the surest way to be disappointed when you do not complete them."
"Dreaming is the only way you will not be disappointed."
"If something is important, pay someone else to do it for you."
"Blessed be the children, for they will inherit the national debt."
"The traveler sees what he sees, the tourist loses the camera."
"Blessed is the man who has nothing to talk about."
"Show me your garden and I will tell you "what a beautiful garden you have"."
"We have to let go of the life we planned… Forget it, plan your life."
"The greatest gift of life is friendship and money."
"Enjoy every minute of your life, every second, start now. Are you enjoying yourself? And now? What about now? This is a good way to create clinical anxiety."
"Smile every day in the mirror. Also brush your teeth."
"Life is not about finding yourself. Is about:"
"Death is not the worst loss of life. The worst loss is what dies within us as we live.\n - Norman Cousins"
"Happiness is a choice, just like being a communist."
"We are what we repeatedly do. For example, I am a rock."
"The best way out is the exit."
"In life, do not wait until the hot iron hits you. Unless you're a cow."
"Great souls have always encountered violent opposition from ghostbusters."
"If you think you can or think you can not, you're right.\n - Henry Ford"
"I lost over 9000 baskets in my career. I lost almost 300 games. 26 times, I was responsible for the turning point and lost.\n - Michael Jordan"
"What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as the love you have for money."
"You can get everything in life you want, if you're not dumb."
"What you do will be insignificant.\n - Mahatma Gandhi"
"Desire is the starting point of all conquests, but it is not enough."
"Sight without action is to dream awake. Action without sight is to create debts."
"In any situation, the best thing you can do is the right thing; The next best is nothing."
"If you keep saying that things are going to be bad, you have a chance to be a prophet.\n - Isaac B. Singer"
"Success consists in being good."
"Keep going and chances are you'll stumble upon something, maybe when you least expect it. I've never heard of anyone tripping over anything if he’s sitting. "
"Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed with the things you did not do than the ones you did.\n - Mark Twain"
"Some succeed because it’s their destiny. Some because they are determined. Most people don’t succeed."
"Experience is what you get when you do not get what you want.\n - Dan Stanford"
"If you want to test your memory, try to remember what you were worrying about a year ago today.\n - E. Joseph Cossman"
"We judge a man's wisdom by how boring he is."
"The best way to cheer yourself up is by using drugs, the second best is by cheering someone up."
"Age is a matter of mind over matter. You lie and others pretend they believe."
"Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is a sign that you are winning."
"Stay away from people who try to minimize your ambitions. Unless your ambitions are to become a drug lord."
"The safest way to not fail is to succeed."
"Take the first step of faith, hopefully you will not fall and break your leg."
"Act or accept."
"Many fantastic ideas are not executed and many great executors are without ideas, but all executed are dead."
"The world is more malleable than you think, especially if you're rich."
"People really become quite remarkable when they begin to think they can do things. A little less remarkable when they give up."
"To live a creative life, we must lose the fear of dying from hunger. Although it is most likely."
"Do not risk the usual for unusual."
"Get an idea. Make that idea your life - think about it, dream about it, live on that idea. Die alone and disappointed."
"All our dreams can come true if we are Walt Disney. Even paying less to ours employees."
"Sitting and waiting is the best way to stay safe."
"If you do what you've always do, you may have a retirement at the end."
"As soon as the caterpillar thought the world was ending, it was right."
"Whenever you see a successful person, you only see the public glories, never the people they stepped on to get there."
"Opportunities do not happen.\n - Chris Grosser"
"Whenever you find the whole world against you, you are probably doing something wrong."
"To be defeated is only a temporary condition; Giving up is what makes it permanent. \n - Marilyn vos Savant"
"Fall seven times, on the eighth, give up."
"The difference between ordinary and extraordinary is the extra on the front."
"Anyone can do something when he has the will and that moment is the last possible moment."
"There are two main choices in life: to accept the conditions as they exist and to accept things as they are."
"The success seems to be related with change. Sometimes with stock exchanges."
"Attitudes are contagious. Like the flu, you end up in bed."
"There are only two rules to succeed. One, find out exactly what you want to do, and two, have the time and money to do it."
"Sooner or later, those who win are those who are lucky."
"Vision usually does not come as a light bulb, it comes slowly until you consider that it is basically impossible to perform it by working eight hours a day."
"Success is a state of mind. If you want success, start thinking of yourself as a success, so your unbearable job becomes a success."
"Faults are part of the menu of life and I have never lost a portion."
"Winners lose much more often than losers.\n - Matthew Keith Groves"
"An idea can turn into powder or magic depending on whether you have the magic grinder or the pepper grinder."
"An obstacle is often a Berlin wall."
"Life is "trying things to see if they work"\n - Ray Bradbury"
"If you worry about yesterday's failures, you can pay off your debt."
"We are all travelers, each sailing on a voyage of discovery, often plundered by pirates and having your ship wrecked, but a voyage."
"I think and think for months and years. Ninety-nine times, I'm wrong.\n - Albert Einstein"
"Where the will is great, the difficulties are too."
"Success is not to be measured by the position that someone has reached in life, but the amount of things he possesses."
"Talent is formed in solitude. \n - Johann Wolfgang von Goethe"
"To avoid criticism, do nothing, say nothing, be nothing.\n - Elbert Hubbard"
"If you want to make your dreams come true, the first thing you need to do is wake up.\n - J.M. Power"
"By working faithfully eight hours a day, you can eventually become a boss and work twelve hours a day.\n - Robert Frost"
"I learned that no matter what happens, or how bad it seems today, life goes on. \n - Maya Angelou"
"The art of being wise is the art of knowing what to ignore.\n - William James"
"In three words, I can summarize everything I have learned about life: it is difficult."
"Sometimes even to live is an act of courage.\n - Seneca"
"Do the first things first and the second things second."
"The only people that find what they are looking for are those with issues."
"Defeat is not bitter unless you swallow it.\n - Joe Clark"
"People do not seem to see that their opinion of the world is also a confession of their character.\n - Ralph Waldo Emerson"
"Those who wish to sing, always bother someone."
"The sun shines and warms and enlightens us and people are not curious to know why this is so. But it's just a giant ball of gas."
"Life is a shipwreck, so it's better have a lifeboat."
"Have you read Quote 34? It is awesome."
"Have you read Quote 34? It has a 34 in front, we forget to take it and we cannot find it anymore."
"If you read Quote 34, please send us an email."
"Bigfoot is real."
"I hate long-lasting habits… Like smoking, it only spends money."
"There is no education like getting a foot in the butt."
"He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.\n -Friedrich Nietzsche"
"Have passion, take action, if it worked, cool, if it didn’t, go for next. There are plenty of fish in the sea and no one is perfect, move on."
"If you do not have the time to do it right the first time, when are you going to fix this crap?"
"Positivity has a lot to do with ignoring what is wrong."
"Never take swimming lessons from a drowning man."
"Life is not about ALL the wrong moves you've made, but some will actually have a very high cost. Do not rob banks."
"Be humble enough to admit that you're not perfect."
"If you cannot sleep, melatonin is a good drug to solve this."
"Look both ways before crossing the street."
"Everything happens for a reason, it just doesn't make a difference."
"If you want to achieve greatness, eat fast food every day."
"Do something that scares you every day. Like opening Doritos from the bottom."
"Nothing in the world is more common than unsuccessful people with talent."
"Knowledge is knowing what can be done. Wisdom is when to give up."
"Your problem is not the problem. Your reaction to the problem is the problem. Problem, problem, problem."
"You can do anything but be an astronaut, this is tough."
"Thought should become your capital asset, at least you will not lose everything you have."
"I think the more I work, the luckier I get.\n - Thomas Jefferson"
"The starting point for all races is the starting line."
"Success is the sum of all efforts, like waking up early, doing the dishes and having talent."
"If you want to reach excellency, better be taller."
"Never give up, just sometimes."
"Every day, kill the man who was born today. This is metaphorical, do not kill people."
"Do not forget to update your antivirus."
"All progress occurs out of bed. Most progress occurs out of bed."
"Choose until tomorrow what you are willing to give up."
"The only place where success comes before work is in the dictionary. \n - Stubby Currence"
"It's not what you see, it's what you do not see. I like cryptic sentences."
"The road to success and the road to failure are almost exactly the same. \n - Colin R. Davis"
"The manager's job is to produce more results with more responsibilities and a small salary increase."
"Success is about liking what you do and making money from it."
"As we move forward in the next century, leaders will be machines and we will have to submit to them."
"A real entrepreneur is someone who does not have a safety net beneath them. That is, trapeze artists can not be entrepreneurs."
"The first step to success is followed by the second step to success."
"When I dare to be powerful - to use my strength at the service of my vision, I am glad that I have been able to get out of bed today."
"The successful warrior is the common man, with swords."
"Discouragement and failure are two of the best steps to success.\n - Dale Carnegie"
"If you do not design your own life plan, you are likely to fall into someone else's plan. And guess what they planned for you? Not much. \n - Jim Rohn"
"If you really want something, do not expect it.\n - Gurbaksh Chahal"
"Do not let the fear of losing be greater than the thrill of winning. That’s a good way to lose everything at the casino."
"Start focusing on the size of you! Whatever that means."
"You cannot connect the dots looking forward; You can only connect them by looking back.\n - Steve Jobs"
"I don’t want to your life to be easier, I want you to be better."
"The number one reason people fail in life is because they listen to their friends, family and neighbors. \n - Napoleon Hill"
"The winners can tell you where they are going, what they plan to do along the way and who will be sharing the adventure with them. \n - Denis Watiley"
"Success does not consist in never making mistakes, but in never making the same mistake twice. \n - George Bernard Shaw"
"I do not want to reach the end of my life and think that I have lived only the length of it. I also wanted to live the width of it. \n - Diane Ackerman (͡ ° ͜ʖ ͡ °)"
"You must expect great things from yourself before you can do them. \n - Michael Jordan"
"People rarely get what they want.\n - Dale Carnegie"
"There is no chance, no destination.\n - Ella Wheeler Wilcox"
"Our greatest fear should not be failure, but of succeeding in things in life that do not matter.\n - Francis Chan"
"You should get up every morning.\n - George Lorimer"
"To be successful, you must accept all the challenges that come, but use a condom."
"Be miserable.\n- Wayne Dyer"
"To accomplish great things, we must not act, but also dream, not only dream, but be good, not just be good, but have talent."
"Glory is fleeting, but darkness is forever.\n - Napoleon Bonaparte"
"The victory goes to the player who makes the next mistake.\n - Chessmaster Savielly Grigorievitch Tartakower"
"Do not be so humble\n -you're not so good. \n - Golda Meir"
"His ignorance is encyclopedic. \n - Abba Eban"
"I can write better than anyone who can write faster,” he said, “and I can write faster than anyone who can write better.\n - A. J. Liebling"
"People demand freedom of speech to compensate for the freedom of thought they avoid.\n - Soren Aabye Kierkegaard"
"A lie gets halfway around the world before the truth has a chance to get its pants on.\n - Sir Winston Churchill"
"I am living so beyond my income that we can almost say that we are living apart.\n - e e cummings"
"In theory, there is no difference between theory and practice. But in practice, it exists.\n - Jan L.A. van de Snepscheut"
"Whether you think you can, or you think you can't—you're right.\n - Henry Ford"
"The only way to get rid of a temptation is to yield to it. \n - Oscar Wilde"
"Don't stay in bed, unless you can make money in bed.\n - George Burns"
"I do not know why we're here, but I'm sure it's not for fun.\n - Ludwig Wittgenstein"
"If you can't get rid of the skeleton in the closet, you better teach it to dance.\n - George Bernard Shaw"
"Talent does what he can, genius does what he should. The drunk does what he wants."
"Some cause happiness wherever they go; others whenever they go.\n - Oscar Wilde"
"I will not waste my days trying to prolong them. \n - Ian L. Fleming"
"If you can count your money, you do not have a billion dollars.\n - J. Paul Getty"
"Facts are enemies of truth. \n - Don Quixote"
"How wrong it is for a woman to expect man to build the world she wants, rather than to create it herself. \n - Anais Nin"
"Maybe this world is another planet’s hell.\n - Aldous Huxley"
"Blessed is the man, who has nothing to say and refrain from giving evidence of the fact.\n - George Eliot"
"I had so much fun, just not today."
"Say something wise and your name will be remembered forever.\n - Anonymous"
"We didn't lose the game, we just ran out of time.\n - Vince Lombardi"
"The optimist proclaims that we live in the best of all possible worlds and the pessimist fears that this is true. \n - James Branch Cabell"
"You can only find truth with logic if you have already found the truth without it.\n - G. K. Chesterfield"
"It's not easy being drunk all the time. Everyone would do it if it were easy.\n - Tyrion Lannister"
"Sometimes when I close my eyes, I can't see."
"Basically, I no longer work for anything other than the feeling I have while working.\n - Albert Giacometti"
"A man's reputation is just as important as monopoly money."
"There is more stupidity than hydrogen in the universe and it has a longer shelf life. \n - Frank Zappa"
"Life is pleasant. Death is peaceful. It is the transition that is problematic. \n - Isaac Asimov"
"It is much better to be crazy and know, than to be healthy and have doubts.\n - G. B. Burgin"
"A great man makes great mistakes."
"A witty phrase does not prove anything. \n - Voltaire"
"Education is the progressive discovery of our own ignorance.\n - Will Durant"
"Everyone is a genius at least once a year. \n - Georg Lichtenberg"
"Success usually comes to those who are too busy to seek it out.\n - Henry David Thoreau"
"Fill in what is empty, empty what is full and scratch the itch. \n - Duchess of Windsor"
"Most people would rather die than think; Many times they do.\n - Bertrand Russell"
"My advice to you is to marry: if you find a good wife, you will be happy, if not, you will become a philosopher. \n - Socrates"
"A narcissist is someone more handsome than you.\n - Gore Vidal"
"The secret of success is knowing something that nobody knows.\n - Aristotle Onassis"
"I would have made a good Pope. \n - Richard M. Nixon"
"The mistakes are all waiting to be made.\n - Savielly Tartakower"
"A little imprecision sometimes saves you a ton of explanation.\n - H. H. Munro"
"If you have nothing good to say about anyone, come and sit by my side.\n - Alice Roosevelt Longworth"
"Forgive your enemies, but never forget their names. \n - John F. Kennedy"
"Everything has been discovered except how to live. \n - Jean-Paul Sartre"
"It is better to have a permanent income than to be fascinating.\n - Oscar Wilde"
"The good thing about the selfish is that they do not talk about other people.\n - Lucille S. Harper"
"You've got to be very careful if you don't know where you are going, because you might not get there.\n - Yogi Berra"
"I love Mickey Mouse more than any woman I've ever met.\n - Walt Disney"
"The cemeteries are filled with indispensable men. \n - Charles de Gaulle"
"You can pretend to be serious; but you can't pretend to be witty.\n - Sacha Guitry"
"There is no more sincere love than love for food. \n - George Bernard Shaw"
"The covers of this book are too far apart."
"Anything that is too stupid to be spoken is sung. \n - Voltaire"
"When choosing between two evils, I always like to try the one I've never tried before.\n - Mae West"
"Happiness is good health and a weak memory. \n - Ingrid Bergman"
"Friends can come and go, but enemies pile up. \n - Thomas Jones"
"Be wary of any company that requires new clothes.\n - Henry David Thoreau"
"I do not feel well. \n - the last words of Luther Burbank"
"Nothing is so wrong in the world that a meteor strike does not solve."
"Sitting alone with my conscience is enough for me. \n - Charles William Stubbs"
"Always do right. This will gratify some people and astonish the rest. \n - Mark Twain"
"Learning is what most adults will do for a living in the 21st century.\n - S. J. Perelman"
"Whatever is begun in anger ends in shame.\n - Benjamin Franklin"
"Keep all the promises you plan to keep."
"Do not try.\n - Charles Bukowski"
"There are worse things than being alone. \n - Charles Bukowski"
"There are only two ways to live your life. One of them is scared, one is with ice cream."
"It is better to fail by being honest than to succeed by stealing cargo."
"Little minds are tamed and subdued by misfortune. \n - Washington Irving"
"You may have to fight a battle more than once. \n - Margaret Thatcher"
"I attribute my success to this: I have never given any excuse.\n - Florence Nightingale"
"Every normal man must be tempted, at times, to spit upon his hands, hoist the black flag, and begin slitting throats.\n - Henry Louis Mencken"
"We are not retreating, we're advancing in another direction.\n - General Douglas MacArthur"
"The man who does not read good books has no advantage over the man who can't read them.\n - Mark Twain"
"Research is what I'm doing when I don't know what I'm doing.\n - Wernher Von Braun"
"The people will not revolt. They will not take their eyes off their screens long enough to realize what's happening \n - George Orwell"
"Every child is an artist. The problem is to remain an artist when he grows up. \n - Pablo Picasso"
"Either you run the day or the day runs you.\n - Jim Rohn"
"Teach your tongue to say, \"I do not know\" and you will progress. \n - Maimonides"
"Begin where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can. \n - Arthur Ashe"
"Happiness is not something prepared. It comes from your own actions. \n - Dalai Lama"
"If you are offered a seat on a rocket, do not ask which place! Just keep going.\n -Sheryl Sandberg"

"First, have a definite practical ideal and clear; A goal. Secondly, have the means necessary to achieve your ends; Wisdom, money, materials and methods. Third, put all your efforts to that end. \n - Aristotle"
"If the wind will not serve, take to the oars."
"You can not fall if you don’t get up."
"Take your life in your own hands, and what happens? A terrible thing: no one to blame.\n - Erica Jong"
"The person who says it can not be done should not interrupt the person who is doing it."
"Better to die of passion than of boredom."
"If you want your children to turn out well, spend twice as much time with them, and half as much money.\n - Abigail Van Buren"
"Create your own dreams or someone will hire you to build theirs.\n - Farrah Gray"
"The battles that count aren't the ones for gold medals. The struggles within yourself - the invisible, inevitable battles inside all of us - that's where it's at.\n - Jesse Owens"
"Education costs money, but then so does ignorance.\n - Sir Claus Moser"
"Remember that sometimes not getting what you want is a wonderful stroke of luck.\n - Dalai Lama"
"You can not exhaust your creativity. The more you use, the more you have. \n - Maya Angelou"
"Remember that no one can make you feel inferior without your consent. \n - Eleanor Roosevelt"
"When you are hungry, eat your rice. When tired, close your eyes. \n - Lin-Chi"
"For the man who only has a hammer, everything he finds begins to look like a nail.\n - Abraham Maslow"
"Do not seek to follow in the footsteps of the wise. Seek what they sought. \n - Basho"
"What we think or what we know, or what we believe, is, in the end, unimportant. The only thing that matters is what we do. \n - John Ruskin"
"Do not walk towards the light, unless you have already died or want to stumble in the dark."
"Tips for success: \n1-Be attractive. \n2-Do not be unattractive."
"War is where the young and stupid are deceived by the old and bitter into killing each other.\n - Niko Bellic"
"If a tree falls in the forest it will stay there."
"A Man chooses, a slave obeys.\n - Andrew Ryan."
"If video games have taught me anything, it's that if you encounter enemies then you’re going on the right way."
"If you like to judge others by what they have done, become a judge. People will continue to dislike you, but at least you will be well paid."
"Nothing is true and everything is permitted. Only if you're part of a group of assassins, because you're probably breaking some laws."
"In the game of chairs you win or you stand."
"Have you ever noticed that people never say \"it's just a game\" when they're winning?"
"It does not matter if they do not remember me, I do not remember anything else myself."
"Live Together, Die Alone.\n - Jack Shephard"
"Remember these numbers 4 8 15 16 23 42, but I do not recommend betting on them."
"Every bad situation is a blues song waiting to happen.\n - Amy Winehouse"
"On the bright side, you are not addicted to morphine."
"No one is trying to be bad fore the sake of being bad, there's always a reason behind it.\n - Aya Cash"
"If life teaches anything, it's that there are no villains. Only people doing their best."
"You either die a hero or live long enough to become the villain.\n - Harvey Dent"
"The distance between insanity and genius is measured only by success."
"Of course this app is trivial, but then most things are."
"Believe me, nothing is trivial."
"If things looks trivial at first, it's because they probably are trivial."
"I once thought I was wrong, but I was mistaken."
"I think people think I like to think a lot. And I don't. I do not like to think at all.\n - Kanye West"
"The real quotes are the ones we find along the way."
"This quote is no longer available."
"If a cat crosses road it doesn't mean bad luck. It means that the cat is going somewhere."
